attributes.action: End Violence and Discrimination through Early Years Education!
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 6 young citizens in the UK are experiencing record levels of anxiety & depression in a mental health pandemic. Gender-based violence & systemic racism continue unabated, all in the midst of an intensifying climate emergency. We have seen the government responding reactively and not preventatively. Evidence-based programmes, like Think Equal, prove that preventative measures do work. Therefore the government needs to reassess its' strategy & prioritize Early Years education.
attributes.background: Mandate Social and Emotional Learning alongside numeracy and literacy – if it is compulsory to learn how to read and count, it must surely be compulsory to learn the value of human beings? Evidence-based programmes exist to prevent mental ill-health, discrimination & violence before it's too late.

rejection.details:
The statutory framework for the early years foundation stage already includes personal, social and emotional development alongside communication and language, and physical development: https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/974907/EYFS_framework_-_March_2021.pdf

We could accept a petition calling for changes to this framework, but it would need to be clear what changes you wanted.
